inn1.comm: on off stump, solidly blocked into the off side...a hint of swing
full and swinging towards Strauss's toes but he's equal to it and gets off the mark with a flick to square leg
perfect start for Bell, clipped nicely off his pads through square leg with super timing...3000 ODIs runs for Bell
corrects his line onto off stump, Bell defends with a straight bat
full on middle and off, punched firmly to mid-on
outside off and left alone...carries fairly low through to Sangakkara
round the wicket, on off stump and defended
pushed back to the bowler
touch shorter, Strauss goes onto the back foot and drives to cover who makes a good save
cracks a cut away square but picks out the man on the edge of the circle
worked into the leg side but can't find a gap
onto the front foot, driven back to Dilshan who starts with a good maiden
opens the face and guides down to third man
pushed across Strauss who also opens the face and sends this square behind point, but third man keeps him to a single
touch short outside off stump but Bell misses out as his back-foot drive finds point
goes full this time at off stump but Bell is comfortably on top of it
driven into the on side, Malinga hops across in his follow through...always full of energy
tight line from Malinga, no width on offer and Bell pushes towards mid-on
almost a run out! Strauss came down the pitch, drove into the covers where Silva brought off a great save and Strauss had to turn quick to get back
that's a bit of a heave as he tries to break the shackles and the ball dribbles through square leg
tossed up on off stump, pushed down the pitch where Dilshan and Strauss get into a tangle...all good natured
driven into the off side
worked back to the bowler...good stuff from Dilshan
worked out to deep midwicket...not much spin for Dilshan but no pace to work with either
lovely shot through the leg side, used his feet and taken from around middle and off with a whip of the wrists which beats deep square-leg
outside off and driven to short cover
tucked off the stumps backward of square on the leg side
that's the line, on off stump and Bell defends
punched off the back foot through the covers, it was a touch shorter and Bell had plenty of time to place his shot
defended into the off side
he can't get this away as he drives to cover
that's close! He went for a sweep and the ball almost deflected into the stumps
misses another sweep as this goes down the leg side but it's not called wide
uses his feet and squirts off the inside edge into the leg side...he's really struggling and has a smile to himself
placed nicely through the off side, presses onto the back foot and opened the face to beat cover
fuller on off stump and worked down to long on
cracked! Short and wide from Mathews, gave  Bell plenty of time to cut it away through the off side...he's looking good
onto the back foot, defended to mid-on
onto the front foot to drive into the off side
flicked into the leg side but midwicket cuts off any runs
not much pace in this pitch and Bell doesn't time this drive which bobbles back towards Mathews
waits a little longer this time and places it towards mid-on who is fairly deep
uses his feet then drives into the off side wide of mid-off but it doesn't have the timing
driven back to the bowler...pressure builds on Strauss
angling towards leg stump and takes the pad
that's better, some nice footwork gets him into position to drive down to long off
worked through midwicket and for a moment they want a couple but decide against it
gone! That was always going to happen. A horrid innings from the captain is ended when misses a pull against a ball that doesn't bounce much. Much deserved for Dilshan
pushed back to the bowler
neatly angled away down to third man...Bell has been playing a different game so far
full outside off, Trott drives to mid-on
driven on the up to short cover
ooh, he had to get a shift on but picked out the right man - Murali at mid-on - to take a quick single

gone! Huge wicket for Sri Lanka as Bell chips a catch to midwicket. Was back of a length and Bell tried to force it through the leg side but didn't keep it down. Was a loose shot and a simple catch. Another start wasted from Bell. England wobbling.
on off stump, defended on the front foot
round the wicket, driven to short cover
pushed off the back foot to mid-off
angled into Trott who blocks to the off side
beats short cover with a drive and gets a single to long off
pushed square on the off side
solid from Mathews, hitting a decent length and line. Trott happy to eat some dot balls for a while
very straight, back of a length this time. Trott punches to mid-on but not on offer
Trott picks out cover with a careful drive

combination of a powerful drive on the up and a slightly clumsy effort from Malinga at mid-off releases some of the pressure, not much though. Given the circumstances England could not ask for a better man than Trott
this is such a big innings for Bopara, if he could just turn in a performance under intense pressure I think his international career could kick off. As it is he drives carefully
ooh dear, Bopara and running is never a serene story. Here he prods to point sets off for a single before turning back in a hurry
Herath has been nothing if not accurate and Trott's full face finds cover
Trott gets down on one knee very early and dinks over his shoulder
yes, no, wait, yes, no, yes. no is the clear calling as Bopara's neat cut shot is half stopped at point. Never run on a misfield they say, and eventually Bopara followed the advice
fullish ball on middle that Bopara gets back to try and defend, looked hurried on the shot
more solid as Bopara comes forward to defend some flight from Herath
silky cut shot to a ball that was a fraction short. Bopara picked a gap behind point and threaded it through beautifully. That ought to ease his palpable nerves for a moment
full and straight from Mathews, and much the same from Trott's bat. Smartly fielded in the follow through
a late turn of the wrists meant Trott picked a gap between the bowler and short  midwicket to earn a single
slightly slower from Mathews and on this track it barely reaches Bopara who was waiting in position to defend
the inside edge helps Bopara get off strike and it dribbles to mid-on
width outside off stump but Trott couldn't make use of it as he clunked a drive to cover. England are pinned back at the moment
Trott again times sweetly but straight to a fielder. Most other batsmen would be frustrated but I doubt Trott has even noticed
tossed up around off stump and Bopara stretches forward to defend under his eyes
ooh, some flight and bite from Herath. Bopara looked to turn it to leg but it spun onto the leading edge
massive shout for lbw as Bopara plays around a quicker ball, looked to be heading to leg but the umpire gave it not out and Sri Lanka opted not to review. Really looked worth another look
ooh! Close again! Bopara goes back to a full and flat ball that skids under his attempted cut this far past off stump
very tentative now Bopara, creeping forward and hanging a bat somewhere in line. The ball slides past the inside edge
Bopara plays for turn that isn't there and ends up prodding with an inside edge. Just shows what one spinning delivery can do. For the moment, Bopara has no clue if it's turning or not
cagey start from Trott getting back to drive to cover, brings Bopara back on strike
Bopara sniffs the ball in defence
very straight from Mendis, as always, and Bopara is more confident on his defence this time

Sangakkara is very confident with a stumping appeal! Might just be to heap pressure on Bopara as he played and missed in defence. His foot just popped up for a moment but it came down in time. Close though. Something has to give soon with Bopara
finally picks up a single, pushing forward in defence towards cover

wonderful bowling has Sangakkara up in appeal again! After spinning a few away this one comes back and through the gate created by Trott's drive. Close to an inside edge, close to a stumping but neither in the end.
Bopara is pinned to the crease in defence. After all the playing and missing I doubt they'd fancy charging down
gold, otherwise known as a single, as Bopara sweeps very uneasily
more conventional from Trott pushing a single down the ground

Bopara could be gone here lbw. Given not out by Doctrove, but he gives everything not out. Sri Lanka review. It was flighted and Bopara got forward and across his stumps. He's more than 2.5m down and 49% of the ball is hitting leg which means it just stays an on-field call
quicker ball dragged down, sweet mercy for Bopara as he turns it to leg
good work from Trott, skipping down the wicket and flicking fine around the corner for a couple that brings up a torturous England 50
a misfield from Malinga means a nervy single becomes more comfortable
not entirely sure Trott read this but he's benefited from another misfield, chopping backwards of point to earn three
Bopara is playing so late, clearly has no idea which way it's spinning
more flight on this, ended up half-volley length but because Bopara is so unsure what's going on he can't time his drive
lovely bowling, everything is straight on a length but spinning in different directions. England making it look impossible
an outside edge trickles down point and Bopara hares off for a tight single. In his excitement Dilshan, who was backing up the throw, tumbled over
some flight on this as Bopara defends
single, precious single, taken with a careful push wide of cover
good shot from Trott, he looks more certain here, full-facing a drive wide of cover for a couple
touch short and a touch wide but it skids on and under Trott's attempted cut
the bounce here is very low, Trott again shaped to cut but could only toe-end it
more flight here and Trott celebrates  by milking a single to long-off
starts bang on a length and line from around the wicket and Trott defends
top-edged sweep loops up towards fine leg, who stood motionless before eventually reacting. Collected on the bounce, could have been close
Bopara on the sweep, a paddle version
doosra early on, oddly Bopara seemed to read it
hint of spin back into Bopara who looks to play with the spin
slightly fuller and quicker, and with Bopara playing Murali off the pitch he looks rushed in defence
Trott forward and stern in defence. He'll be loving all this scrapping
flight from Mendis finds an inside edge while Trott drives
Bopara forward to prod a defence
very straight from Mendis, absolutely nowhere for Bopara to go unless he manufactures something
the slightest hint of angle towards the pads means Bopara can inside-edge a single to midwicket
Trott prods to point to end  another tight over
picks this off leg stump and tickles it past short fine-leg
steps back towards leg then drives square through the off side out to the sweeper
finds the inside edge as Trott plays forward but no one at short leg
onto the back foot and punched down the ground
that's very nicely done from Bopara, glides it past slip with a delicate late cut but some brilliant work on the boundary denies him a boundary
swept from outside off down to deep square
goes down early for another sweep and sends it to deep backward square
lofted down towards long on, was in the air for quite a while but well short of the fielder
bad and pad together into the off side
worked from off stump down to long on...sensible batting from this pair
low full toss which Bopara bunts down the ground
on off stump and defended to the off side
opens the face for a scampered single to backward point
comes forward and defends to the off side

what happened there?! Trott when for a reverse sweep, the top edge just eluded Sangakkara and there was nearly an awful mix-up in the running as Bopara ambled down for a single. Trott was very late setting off but the throw was poor
defended to the off side
guided backward of point and deep cover as to race around the boundary
over the wicket now, flicked off his toes out to deep square
boy oh boy...nearly another mix-up in the running as Bopara works into the leg side and there are more stutters before Trott makes his ground
gets a top edge as he sweeps but short fine-leg is vacant and they make it back for a second
swept again, from very wide outside off which means it goes square through the leg side
pushed back to the bowler
plays this off the pitch as he defends
pushed down the on side, Mendis parries it in his follow through but there isn't a single
pushed off the back foot to cover
steps across the crease and flicks it to deep square
these two are having a shocking time running...almost another mix-up as Bopara flicks to short fine-leg
this one is worked comfortably along the ground through midwicket
flicked to deep square-leg
been quite leg-stumpish from Murali and this one takes the pad
full outside off which Trott pushes out to deep cover
good length outside off, enough width to allow Bopara time to open the face and find third man
banged in short outside off, the first bouncer of the day, and Trott watches it sail through gently
goes for the trademark yorker but Trott manages to whip it to midwicket
this one comes out as a low full toss but Trott again finds the midwicket fielder
full on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler and that's a good comeback over from Malinga
round the wicket, a strong sweep from Bopara but goes straight to deep square
swept from leg stump but there's a short fine-leg in place now who fields it
walks across the crease then works this off the stumps to deep square
tossed up a little more, neatly worked away through midwicket...England still happy with the nudges
dragged down a little short, Trott flat-bats a pull down to long on and didn't really connect

gone! Muralitharan makes the breakthrough as Bopara is given lbw sweeping a very full delivery. Murali was round the wicket, it struck him full on the pad and was hitting middle. Bopara reviewed but it was stone dead
driven into the off side
big full toss which Trott flicks through the leg side
another full toss and Trott works through the leg side again
full on off stump, defended into the covers
that's a good one, full on middle with a hint of swing but Morgan is able to work it wide of mid-on
Trott is beaten for pace as he goes for a pull and gloves it over the keeper towards third man where Murali pulls off the some great footwork to save the boundary...brings up England's 100
there's the first dink sweep from Morgan, taken from well outside off towards fine leg
flicked in the air but wide of midwicket
tossed up outside off, Morgan drives square with a little flourish but it's only a single
comes forward and defends
goes back and flicks straight to short fine-leg
very full on leg stump, there's an appeal as Trott misses but it's not given and Sangakkara doesn't bother to review
short on leg stump and helped down to fine leg with a neat pull...Morgan should improve the running
back of a length outside off, defended back down the pitch
well, he's timed the pants off that...was a slower ball, Morgan drove and stopped the shot but the ball raced over the infield
outside off and left alone
opens the face and defends to backward point where Dilshan fields well
short ball, Morgan doesn't connect cleanly with the pull but it loops wide of mid-on
Trott on the sweep and playing it well, fine around the corner for a couple
the boundary count is flying! Sort of. Too short and a touch wide, Trott doesn't look like he timed his back-foot drive but it races away to the rope. His first boundary in 65 deliveries
boundary followed by a flick towards midwicket. Excellent work from Trott who has been the giant of England's campaign
Murali dares some air up around off stump, Trott drags it down to long-on to make him the highest scorer in the tournament
very careful forward prod from Morgan
too short and Morgan has England motoring, gets deep into his crease and chops down to the third man rope. 13 off the over, which feels like 113 after the barren first 30 overs
Mendis is greeted with a full-face push down the ground
very straight from Mendis as usual and Morgan milks a single to long-off
Trott down very early to spoon one over his shoulder
Morgan flicks his wrists to ping this straight to midwicket
touch of extra bounce here forces Morgan to stand taller in defence

dropped! Samaraweera puts down a sitter! Morgan misread one that spun away from him as he aimed a drive it swirled off the edge straight down towards deep point who ran in, steadied himself, and inexplicably spilled the chance
Morgan celebrates his let off by chipping an extra cover drive and haring back for two
touch shorter here and Morgan chops down to deep point
among all the nerves there is Trott, utterly unmoved and continuing his quiet accumulation
Morgan flicks and misses a work to leg
another misfield, this time at short cover, allows Morgan a single
50 for Trott, fifth half-century of the tournament. Gets there by reverse-dabbing a very full ball towards third man. This has been a stunning effort under pressure
Trott on the reverse again, taking this from outside leg stump and redirecting to point. All for no run
this time he works with the angle, picking off a single to deep square
very close call for Morgan, playing back and missing in front of the stumps. Struck bang in front but it pitched outside leg. Only just
Mendis has the measure of Morgan here, can't read him
again Morgan cagey in defence. Mendis spinning them only a fraction, but in opposite directions
Morgan playing Mendis off the pitch, which makes it seem rushed and tentative
Trott calmly forward to prod a defence
horrid delivery speared down the leg side but a fine take
carefully pushed away into space
Morgan skips down but some turn for Dilshan finds a leading edge
hint shorter and the width on offer allows Morgan to flash a cut away
Trott hangs outside leg stump looking for room but Dilshan follows him so he tickles around the corner

edged but it's four! Morgan jumps back and outside leg to give himself room. Dilshan fired it in quicker and it flew off a top edge through a vacant slip down to third man. Morgan is just shifting to pace of this innings now
pushed quietly but solidly down the ground
Morgan waits back and flicks his wrists over the ball to send it to deep midwicket
enough width for Trott to aim a drive but he picks out mid-off
just a touch too short from Herath, allows Trott to get back and whip a couple into the leg side
lovely shot this, Trott stretching across outside off stump and flicking to leg
Morgan winds up very early for his reverse sweep but doesn't get much of it. He hasn't actually nailed one of those in a while
starts with a slower ball, back of a length, that Morgan works to midwicket
fuller slower ball this time, but the line is on the pads and allows Trott to nudge a single
there is nothing off the pitch here. Just pitches and dies though. Tremlett might get caned. For now Morgan defends
touch more devil on this delivery has Morgan hurrying back to block
loud appeal from Malinga but not much from anyone else as Morgan fresh-airs a swish across the line. Looks very close on second viewing actually
Morgan celebrates his reprieve by creaming and extra-cover drive to the sweeper on the rope
swirling, swishing reverse-thwack attempted, again Morgan doesn't get it fully but a single is earned
no such frivolity from Trott on this occasion, clipping a single around the corner
Morgan reverts to something more conventional and dabs a single to leg
pushed into space now, England ticking along nicely
singles galore as Morgan flips towards midwicket
Trott spoils the run of dots by missing a full ball on his pads
oh my goodness me. Morgan plays the lottery and wins it again. Dropped at deep cover. Lofted straight to the man who unbelievably put it down.
Trott is steadier, working a single
life No. 4! This is stunning. Murali is fuming and rightly so. Morgan sliced straight to point who dived forward and spilled the chance. Tougher one but cripes.
well how can Morgan not go on to make something of this. Sri Lanka are giving him all the help he needs
Trott is solid among the madness picking off a single
quietly pushed into space
Morgan gets across his stumps and pushes a single around the corner
Trott this time works a single into space
Sri Lanka really ragged now. They are stunned for the moment by their ineptitude. Morgan on the reverse-sweep again, once again he doesn't get very much of it but beat the keeper and it raced away
clipped away to deep midwicket
Trott gets back and aims a chopped cut but cannot time it
this time a single is flicked off the pads to deep midwicket
reverse sweep which goes square into the off side
touch short which gives Morgan time to cut out to deep cover off the back foot
worked down to long on
this one finds the edge as Morgan plays forward with soft hands
tight line on off stump, defended into the covers
worked off leg stump towards short fine-leg
flicked away from middle and leg to deep midwicket
misses a reverse sweep and half a shout for lbw
flicked towards midwicket
low full toss which Trott pushes down the ground
worked along the ground through midwicket with excellent placement which allows them to come back for a second...and there was another fumble in the deep
steps back and pulls a slightly short ball through midwicket
angled away to third man
terrific yorker homing in on middle stump, Trott does well to squeeze it out for a single
gives himself a touch of room but can only pushed a good yorker to point...the single is enough to reach a fine fifty and his bat has broken in the process. A huge chunk has come out of the bottom
stays very full, driven off a thick outside to third man
tries to open up the leg side but can only thump this straight to mid-on

gone! This time Sri Lanka take a catch and the Powerplay works for the bowling side again. Full outside off, Morgan tried to go over the covers but lofts a chancer to cover who takes it comfortably. Fine innings from Morgan, but England needed him to finish these 50 overs
gone! That didn't last long. Swann goes for the reverse slog-sweep and is stone dead. He set himself so early the bowler hadn't delivered. England coming off the rails in the Powerplay again
driven wide of mid-off so he's away first ball
worked into the leg side
full on the stumps, flicked out to deep midwicket
worked into the gap at square leg
goes onto the back foot and punches in the air down to long on
full toss outside leg stump but Trott only flicks it out to deep square
width outside off and Prior drives sweetly but straight to the fielder...that's the thing about Powerplays, fewer gaps
superb yorker and all Prior can do is keep it out
another full one and this it's pushed down to long on...still no Powerplay boundaries
slower ball short outside off, that's well bowled and beats Trott's attempted guide to third man
speared wide outside off and although Trott gave himself room that's still called
brilliant yorker to finish with and it's dug out back to the bowler...impressive stuff from Sri Lanka's bowlers
backs away and cuts but again picks out a fielder at point
lofts this in the air over midwicket and it lands short of the man in the deep
reverse sweep from Trott and he doesn't connect...an appeal for lbw but it struck his arm
worked down to long on
very full, heaved along the ground through midwicket and some swift work by long on prevents a second
worked into the leg side, Trott wanted to come back for a second but it wasn't on
launches this over the cover ring, gave himself a bit of room and swung hard at a full ball...it doesn't quite reach the boundary
slower short ball and Prior is almost through his shot but managed to pull it to deep square
moves away to leg and drills this straight to cover...he connected well there but without the placement
that's a tad unlucky for Malinga to be called...it was a good bouncer and a superb take from Sangakkara as Trott ducks
jabs another yorker into the off side
clubbed into the off side and there's almost a collision as they run the single
driven firmly into the covers but can't beat the fielder
punched back to the bowler...Trott hasn't got much energy left
goes for a sweep and takes the pad into the leg side
superb from Herath as he follows Trott and he plays over the top of it
fired in at the stumps, edged down to short third-man
dragged down short, it was there to smash away but he picks out deep midwicket with one bounce
finally they find the boundary as Trott digs deep into his reserves and sweeps strongly to beat deep square
tries a reverse sweep but doesn't make contact
swept away to deep square
gone...Trott goes trying to clear the rope as a top edged a sweep is safely taken at deep square and he drags himself off the park
he's really limping...speared down the leg side, the keeper misses it as well so that's a bonus for England
some nice footwork from Prior who clips it through midwicket
down the pitch and this time it's hit with power as Prior slog-sweeps over midwicket...one bounce across the boundary as Murali hobbles badly
reverse sweeps a ball that spins so it lobs into the off side
he wanted to target the leg side but had to adjust at the last minute and dabs into the covers
beaten outside off as this swings and Wright plays over it...was a slower ball
full outside off, Wright has an ugly heave at fresh air and wastes another delivery
another slower ball but Wright connects this time...however only for a single to midwicket
excellent from Prior...was back of a length, he waited for it then used the pace to ramp it fine of third man
full at the stumps, Prior swings hard and gets a single to midwicket to end the innings

inn2.comm: swing first up! Actual swing. Comes back to Tharanga as he aims to cut and cramps him for room
swing again, from bat and ball and it's a play and miss outside off stump. Tharanga aiming another cut shot
Tharanga is desperately seeking room outside off, gets the slightest hint and crashes to point
shape back into Tharanga from back of a length. Defended to cover. In the meantime England have a pop at Dilshan who is full of chat in response
Bresnan loses his line and it thuds off the pads past Prior leaving a knackered Jonathan Trott to scoot round from fine leg and cut off inside the rope
solid finish to a solid opening over from Bresnan. Back of a length and defended
ooh, Dilshan flashes at width outside off but the ball spins back sharply to find an inside edge
down the leg side here, spinning again and Prior collects
prodded carefully with the spin into the midwicket region
ooh, Swann loves a left-hander and this has spun more than anything today. Looping onto a length and ripping past a groping outside edge
Tharanga very  careful after that, playing late and under his eyes
good work from Tharanga, backing himself to drive despite big turn, leans into the shot, threads past a diving short cover and only a slow outfield prevents four
short and a hint of width, Bresnan has suffered at Tharanga's hands many years ago but this will stir the memories. Mullered through backward point
Tharanga shaping up to go big again, just wants to free his arms outside off. No room here though to it trickles to cover
wrong length again, wrong line too. Tharanga happily scythes a cut down to Tremlett at third man
Tremlett into action again at third man, always looks a touch precarious getting down to field, this flies off a thickish edge but generous room from Bresnan once more
much tighter on off stump to Dilshan, which you really have to be. Hanging leg side Dilshan still manages to flash to point but without much power
much fuller length, straighter too. Probably the best place to bowl to Dilshan and it's stroked back to the bowler
tossed invitingly from Swann, imploring something silly from Tharanga but it's carefully defended
how about that, first six of the match! Tharanga skips down the wicket, eases his arms through the ball and sends it sailing into the sightscreen
haha, excellent response from Swann who tosses it up even higher. Driven back hard, and it cannons off the non-striker's bat but they take the run anyway
plenty of spin here again, into Dilshan as he tries to edge up the wicket
this is really ragging, Dilshan wants room outside off but it follows him onto the pads
nicely done from the batsman, calmly threading past the bowler for a single down the ground
ooh, somehow Dilshan survives! Bouncer dug in and beat Dilshan for pace, ended up spooning it just over midwicket's head
fuller from Bresnan, much fuller and Tharanga will feel he missed out on his pads there
good line, hanging it around off stump. Tharanga back and solid in defence
Tharanga calmly defends from the crease. Plenty of room on the leg side so the line has to be good
Bresnan maintains a very tight line and Tharanga is as tight in defence
excellent over drags things back a touch, finishes very straight, back of a length and Tharanga coolly stands tall to block
Swann offers some air but overpitches and Dilshan climbs into the drive, pinging it all along the ground through the covers for four
Swann puts plenty on this and drags it down as a result. The turn ensures there is no space for Dilshan to free his arms
oh dear, Luke Wright misfields at point to turn a dot ball into three. Swann is not amused
Swann looks more comfortable against the left-hander and Tharanga defends
quicker ball is speared down leg, Prior hopped across to save
held back a touch from Swann and has Tharanga reaching for this
ooh, good cricket here as Tharanga skips down the wicket and Swann fires it in quicker. Almost squeezes through. This is brewing nicely
good start from Tremlett, hammering a length but some zipping extra bounce takes it over Dilshan's flashing blade
strangled shot as Tremlett fires in a fuller ball, just sliding into Dilshan and rapping him on the pads. Was heading down leg
how has that missed!? Jagged back from a length and sliced Dilshan in two, heading just over the stumps. That ball came back a long, long way. Good start from Tremlett here
the bowler is lucky to get away with this, floated up full outside off stump but Dilshan went a touch too hard at his drive
floated up to drive again, Dilshan leant back and flung his arms at it, flew off the edge down to third man
Tremlett ends an excellent first over by landing this on a length, seaming into the batsman who defends with an inside edge
not a great start to the spell, dishes up length outside off and it's slashed  backwards of point for four
this is indecently close to off stump! Somehow it misses and Dilshan flashes a drive, might even have clipped a stump but the bail was unmoved and it beat Prior and raced away for four
Dilshan is still swinging away merrily, not much timing here though
ooh, Dilshan is lucky again. Bopara sliding it back into him and an inside edge from a flashing blade saves the batsman
Tharanga more careful and misses out on a leg-side flick as Bopara heads onto the pads
Bopara finds the pads again from a slightly shorter length. There's a touch of movement out there to keep England interested but it's an ideal start for Sri Lanka
somehow Tremlett has got away with this, floating up a half-volley that Dilshan carves to cover
this time Dilshan doesn't miss out. This isn't actually a half-volley but Dilshan backed himself to thrash through the covers and got all of it
not the place to bowl, shortish of a good length sits up asking for trouble. Dilshan hangs back and swishes to square leg
much better ball, fuller and straight. Dilshan offers utmost respect in defence
Sri Lanka are flying now! Fifty stand as Tremlett dishes up some filth short and wide outside off and it's crashed to the point boundary
this was hit even harder, but straight to point. Strauss immediately calls for a change at Tremlett's end
Bopara full outside off and Tharanga steers to point
wow, this swings a long way and past the outside edge
on the pads and Tharanga lifts it high and hard towards the midwicket boundary. Sri Lanka motoring and shades of England's quarter-final pasting at their hands in 1996 now
mishit drive goes uppish towards Bopara
on the pads will always be trouble for the bowler and Tharanga helps himself by tucking three straight of midwicket
crashes to Strauss at short cover
round the wicket, on off stump and pushed into the off side
on middle and off, Tharanga easily onto the front foot
defended into the covers
this one takes an inside edge into the leg side
ooh, nearly finds a leading edge as he tries to play to the leg side
worked down to long on and that's a steady start for Tredwell
starts on the pads but Tharanga doesn't make contact
angling towards leg stump and again the batsman falls over as he tries to work it away
defends a straight ball into the leg side
touch shorter and it's work wide of midwicket
ooh, bit of nibble for Wright and the movement into Dilshan finds the inside edge which scoots out to deep square
nicely driven back past a diving Wright down to long on
low full toss which is comfortably pushed down to long on
ooh, almost the breakthrough but Dilshan's back-cut flew just wide of Strauss at slip
that's a lovely shot, slightly overpitched outside off and excellent footwork means he can drive through the covers

close again! Tremlett appears to lose this as he's very late to run in from the boundary. Tredwell had beaten Tharanga in the air with a lovely piece of bowling but it ended up landing short of long off
defended to the off side
skips down the pitch then drives to cover...the openers so far giving a lesson in how to play spin
down the leg side and that's hurt Prior as he doesn't glove it cleanly
worked away out to deep square
on leg stump and that's an easy shot to pick out deep square-leg
touch wide but Dilshan misses his cut...England still await an edge
very full and driven to mid-on
more good fortune for Dilshan as he drives in the air wide of cover...he's lived a charmed life in this innings, bit like Morgan did earlier
clipped neatly down to long on
full on off stump and driven to short cover
short on leg stump, he plays back and works out to deep midwicket
on middle, Dilshan defends on the front foot
opens the face as he drives to find the gap at cover...the innings has calmed down a little now
what a beauty! Lovely drift then it spun past the outside edge
pushed into the off side for an easy single
good line on middle and off, played into the covers
tucked off leg stump to midwicket
wrong line again, on the pads but it only dribbles away into the leg side for a single
angling into the pads of the right hander then bobbles into the leg side
driven neatly to the left of mid-off who is inside the circle
good work by Wright in his follow through as he gets a hand on a punchy shot from Tharanga
that's a big blow...superb footwork from Dilshan then he drives high and handsome over wide long off
nice response from Tredwell as Dilshan is beaten outside off when trying to push into the off side
now goes back in the crease to nudge a single into the square-leg area...superb manipulation of a spinner
rocks back and guides to backward point
onto the front foot driving to cover
more air this time, very full and Tharanga drives out to the cover sweeper
round the wicket, a low full toss is clipped to midwicket
pushed down the leg side and doesn't touch anything
driven gently down the ground to long off
opens the face and runs it to short third-man
down the pitch and gets a thick outside which flies past short third-man, racing to the boundary...Swann actually did Dilshan in the air
swift footwork and driven out to deep cover
defended into the off side
starts well on middle stump, Dilshan defends into the off side
takes the pad behind square on the leg side
full outside off, driven out to deep cover
banged in short outside off and it loops gently through to Prior
brings out the pull against this short ball and helps it down to long leg
that's nicely done, it may have looked streaky but he was in control of the strike as he opened the face and guided down to third man well wide of the line slip
beaten by a beauty, but it goes for four byes as it spins between bat and pad then beats Matt Prior
comes forward and pushes to backward point
down the pitch and drills a drive to short cover
swept into Bell at short leg who premeditated the shot and was skipping around from his position then it flies away to square leg
driven off the back foot into the covers
worked into the leg side
this slides off the edge down to third man. England dragging themselves around now
up on the toes and Tharanga flicks hard, all along the ground to deep square
Dilshan gets his 50, from 57 deliveries. Made what looked like a tough chase a cakewalk. Treads through the covers and waves his bat towards his dressing room
dug in short and Tharanga dips underneath it
Tharanga stands still in his crease and pats to cover
again Tharanga stands still but this time eases his arms through the line, sending the ball over mid-off and thudding into the fence
Swann tosses one up around off stump but Dilshan confidently steps into a drive for a single to cover
fifty for Tharanga now, pushes it down to long-on and jogs through for a single. The crowd applause is constant now
excellent fielding from Bresnan on the midwicket boundary, hares in and dives forward and if he were pouncing to eat the ball to cut off a very hard-hit sweep
Tharanga places this into space to jog a single
Dilshan is middling everything now, even his forward-blocks and crashing to the fielders
touch slower from Swann, Dilshan waits and chops behind square
Tredwell is back and starts a touch short, Dilshan hops back and chops to deep point
carefully punched into space
Dilshan waits on the back foot and aims a cut
firmly driven through cover
enough space here outside off to Tharanga to squeeze a cut away
full-face of the bat sends this for a riskless single down to long-off
starts with a horrid ball, dragged short and wide outside off. Dilshan missed a cut for no good reason
better delivery here around off stump and Dilshan carves to point
enough width on offer again for Dilshan to flash away to deep point
pace and bounce climbs past a groping outside edge
good delivery again here. Fuller and a hint of movement away. Tharanga solid in defence
swing into Tharanga this time, veered towards the pads but the leg-side flick was missed.
starts with a waist-high slower-ball full toss that Tharanga dismisses from his sight by crashing down the ground
on a length and line this time and Tharanga  blocks
full of length, Tharanga clears his front leg and crashes to mid-on
touch shorter and Tharanga steers to point
clipped around the corner to an easy single
Dilshan shapes for a booming drive but ends up more secure, pushing to cover
Tremlett again hammers one on a length and spears it away past the outside edge
dropped! England needed some luck and Tremlett's right hand almost found it. Tharanga crashed it back at the bowler and it hit the hand before falling to ground
steered wide of point for a single
Dilshan aims a big drive and without timing it perfectly finds cover
more controlled shot from Dilshan, standing tall to punch to deep cover
good delivery here, swinging back into Tharanga who digs out a yorker. There is some movement out there
Bopara floats one up on a length and Dilshan leans a drive to cover
sliding into the batsman again, cramping for space as Dilshan aims a cut
flash and a miss outside off. Just a lazy period for these two batsman at the moment
good lines from Bopara, sliding onto middle stump and leaving Dilshan nowhere to go
play and miss outside off. Dilshan flashed loosely and Prior spilled the take which allowed a bye
ooh, flash and a miss again outside off. Prior again spills the take and boots the turf in disgust
touch of swing here into Dilshan who digs it out and clips with the angle to midwicket
very firm drive but straight to mid-off
width allows Tharanga to drive to deep point
Tremlett in the middle of a good spell, all a touch late though. Dilshan drives hard to point
ooh, the period of pressure almost paid off as Dilshan slashed uppishly towards third man but it reached on the bounce
dropped again. Tremlett again. Smashed back at him, easier chance this time to his left, two hands to it but it burst through
finally Dilshan releases the pressure. Drilling a full-blooded drive over mid-off's head for four. Really went hard and flat to the ropes
Bopara is lucky to get away with this, heading down the leg side but finds the pads
shortish and Dilshan swishes his pull shot down to midwicket
very careful and respectful defence to point
back of a length and hurrying onto Tharanga who blocks
thuds off the pads and dribbles away on the leg side to end the over
steered to third man very easily by Tharanga
hammered short of a length, wide too and Dilshan cuts to deep point
fuller this time, straighter too and blocked to cover
Bresnan veers onto the pads and Dilshan tucks away a single to bring up the Sri Lanka 150
flash and a miss outside off. No real reason why
Tharanga looks a touch bored out there, here he mistimes a heave down the ground.
round the wicket, on middle and pushed easily down the ground
connects with a powerful sweep from outside off and sends it racing through square leg
no holding back now, the field is up and Dilshan is on the charge as he comes down the pitch and lofts Tredwell inside out over cover
goes back to cut but doesn't make contact and is angry with himself
down the track outside leg stump and drives firmly to cover who can't stop it cleanly
this is outstanding batting, lofts it clean over cover with precise footwork and a confident strike. Tredwell taken apart
driven firmly into the off side
full on the stumps and forced back to Bresnan in his follow through
gives himself room and slashes away square through the off side...that came off the bat with real heat
full again and driven down to mid-off
a slower, loopy bouncer outside off stump and Tharanga just watches it go through
now he goes over the leg side, lofted towards deep midwicket but it's chased down by Jonathan Trott
pushed into the leg side
worked out to deep square-leg
power and placement from Tharanga as he threads this through the covers with a flowing drive
full on the stumps and dug out down to long on
ah, Dilshan tries to bring his scoop shot but it doesn't quite work as it comes off the toe and loops short of point...a few smiles between batsman and bowler
hint of swing, flicked into the leg side
oh my goodness, Dilshan has just hurled his bat towards square leg after losing his grip while trying to play a pull shot...smiles all round
connects with the pull this and keeps hold of his bat
round the wicket and beautifully struck straight down the ground through mid-on...a shot of high class
cut away out to deep cover
flicked through the leg side...very easy now for Sri Lanka
some frustration there from Bresnan as he bangs in a short ball that Tharanga sways away from
and he's been greeted by a thumping sweep for six over deep square-leg...that's the biggest part of the ground
sharp spin and Dilshan almost chops on as he tries to cut
paddled through short fine-leg
pushed down to long off
tries to find a gap at cover but there's no run this time
goes down early and sweeps it very fine with a touch of deftness
whipped from around off stump wide of mid-on
comes half forward and it finds an inside edge to deep square-leg
back of a length and it's pulled into midwicket without much timing
dragged down short on leg stump and it's pulled easily to fine leg
lovely shot as he angles the bat down to third man when offered some width...nice piece of footwork stops the boundary
doesn't time this pull as he rolls to mid-on
down the pitch to a full toss and driven to long off
worked down to long on
defended back to the bowler
steps back and cuts between cover and backward point...Dilshan still quick between the wickets

there it is, a brilliant hundred for Dilshan...another cut shot brings him the boundary he needed, this time it was placed with the power to beat the infield. A moment to savour for Dilshan who is having a wonderful tournament
tucked off his pads so he keeps the strike
back of a length, cut firmly down to third man
there are four of them, stands tall and scythes it away over backward point when offered a hint of width...no holding back
round the wicket, goes for a pull but it comes off the bottom of the bat
pulls this one away out to deep square...will he have a word with his team-mate to block a few?
another short ball which is helped out to deep square...looks like Dilshan has cramp. Shall we have two runners?
fired well down the leg side, excellent stop by Prior but they steal another extra as well
plays for his partner and defends to the leg side
driven inside-out over extra cover
played gently down to long off
worked down the ground...they'll happily get them in singles
steps back and cuts through the off side...lovely shot, but that won't help Tharanga
now we have an exaggerated block from Dilshan to basically a long hop
this is given so much air and is so slow, but still Dilshan defends...a good natured finish to the match
ooh, gives himself room to try and drive but mistimes it back to the bowler
has a swing and gets a thick inside edge into the leg side but the single is turned down
there it is! Hundred for Tharanga and victory for Sri Lanka as he drives through the covers... emphatic way to end a brilliant run chase
